verbose_text: In Drosophila, Activin signaling is initiated by the binding of any one of the three Activin-type ligands, Actbeta, Daw, or Myo, to a complex of the type I transmembrane receptor Baboon (Babo) and type II transmembrane receptor Punt.
evidence: Activin signaling is initiated by the binding of any one of the three Activin-type ligands, Actbeta, Daw, or Myo, to a complex of the type I transmembrane receptor Baboon (Babo) and type II transmembrane receptor Punt
